Docs.summary: Provides event information for events that occur when a tooltip opens or closes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a tooltip opens and closes, this class provides event information. The element that specifies the tooltip inherits from either <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> or <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement>. Therefore, open and close events exist on both of these classes. The following table lists the events that use this class.
|Events that occur when a tooltip opens|Events that occur when a tooltip closes| |--------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTipOpening?displayProperty=fullName>|<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTipClosing?displayProperty=fullName>| |<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement.ToolTipOpening?displayProperty=fullName>|<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement.ToolTipClosing?displayProperty=fullName>|
These events are registered by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTipService> class as the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTipService.ToolTipOpeningEvent> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTipService.ToolTipClosingEvent> fields. The <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement> classes both implement the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTipService> and expose this event by defining the events in the previous table
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTipEventArgs> class overrides the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeEventHandler%2A> method. However, this protected member does not appear on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTipEventArgs> list of members because the method is sealed and cannot be overridden in classes from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTipEventArgs>. The implementation of the method in this class casts the event handler delegate that is provided as a parameter to the method to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTipEventHandler> type.
If the tooltip is defined as a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTip> object, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTip.Opened> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTip.Closed> events of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTip> class are also raised when a tooltip opens and closes.
